result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Buckholt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentence may be served with huber.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Buckholt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Talked with Agent Elizabeth Hartford, defendant has paid all financial obligations and has complied with all conditions; no need to have a PRH.
43

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
2:30 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the amended charge of Disorderly Conduct with no repeater.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.  No objection by Atty Privat to the amendment.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the amended charge.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

60 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.  Huber.  Out of county travel and out of county service.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:36 p.m.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 24, 2016 at 08:15 am.

10:48 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - just need a jury trial date.  Court sets for Jury trial on June 24, 2016 at 8:15 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:53 a.m.

10:43 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests a trial date.  All motions and witness lists are to be file by March 28, 2016.  Status Hearing on March 29, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:44 a.m.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
11:15 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - has a petition for court appointed counsel.  Atty Privat confirms she has been appointed.  Court denies the defendant's petition. Statement by Atty Privat - just picked up Discovery and needs to review.  Court sets for Status Hearing on February 15, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:16 a.m.

9:32 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will be getting an attorney, but does not qualify for PD representation and requests court appointed counsel.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant - no longer employed due to transportation.  Court sets for Status Hearing on December 8, 2015 at 9:15 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 9:33 a.m.

9:03 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will be getting an attorney, but needs more time.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 24, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:04 a.m.

Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:04 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Shane W.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 27, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:06 a.m.
